common

Class Context

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.Context

  • public class Context
extends java.lang.Object
    The class which holds the data of each client. Static class which will help to hold the common data that more than one class will use

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> askingCtrl
      if controller want to ask from another controller some data, the controller will add itself.
      static ClientConsole clientConsole
      Each client has one ClientConsole
      static Factory fac
      Because we don't need several different instances of the same controller, but we don't want them to be static (for privacy matters), we will construct one instance of each by the Factory class.
      static ParentGUIController mainScene
      the controller of the main scene, which include menu and content
      static Order order
      will save data for current Order if exist

    • Field Detail

      • clientConsole

        public static ClientConsole clientConsole
        Each client has one ClientConsole

      • askingCtrl

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> askingCtrl
        if controller want to ask from another controller some data, the controller will add itself.
        Now, when the server will return the wanted data, ClientController will know how asked the data, and will send it to it by the askingCtrl, which will build as queue.

      • fac

        public static Factory fac
        Because we don't need several different instances of the same controller, but we don't want them to be static (for privacy matters), we will construct one instance of each by the Factory class.

      • order

        public static Order order
        will save data for current Order if exist

      • mainScene

        public static ParentGUIController mainScene
        the controller of the main scene, which include menu and content

    • Method Detail

      • getUser

        public static User getUser()
        getter for user
        Returns:
        user

      • setUser

        public static void setUser(User newuser)
        User.getPermissions() will indicate the current User's permission.
        Because we have also Customers and StoreWorkers as entities, if the permission equals to Customer or StoreWorker, we will save user as Customer or StoreWorker, which inherits from User
        Parameters:
        newuser - the new User that connected

      • setStoreWorkers

        public static void setStoreWorkers(java.util.ArrayList<StoreWorker> storeWorkers)
        The answer from Server, after asking StoreWorker/s
        Parameters:
        storeWorkers - the StoreWorker/s asked from Server

      • getUserAsCustomer

        public static Customer getUserAsCustomer()
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        if user is INSTANCEOF Customer, return user as Customer
        Returns:
        user as Customer
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if user isn't INSTANCEOF Customer

      • getUserAsStoreWorker

        public static StoreWorker getUserAsStoreWorker()
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        if user is INSTANCEOF StoreWorker, return user as StoreWorker
        Returns:
        user as StoreWorker
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if user isn't INSTANCEOF StoreWorker

      • askOrder

        public static void askOrder(java.math.BigInteger customerID,
                            Store store)
        ask an InProcess Order for ManualTransactionGUIController - by StoreWorker
        Parameters:
        customerID - the Customer.getCustomerID() which the order's is his/her
        store - where the Order being made
